articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: First, there was faux outrage that the Celtic – Aberdeen game later this month was not on TV.  Now, the sights have been trained on Celtic, who reserved their right to have five, instead of seven, home games shown on live TV. Sky Sport can broadcast up to five games from any ground.  This is [...]
articles.title: Faux TV outrage, Celtic curiously alone

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LUKE McCOWAN is gearing up for a personal Paradise hat-trick. The £1million recruit from Dundee on deadline day has already sampled two back-to-back Parkhead triumphs aince his arrival. Self-confessed Hoops fan McCowan made his debut as a substitute in the 3-0 romp against Philippe Clement’s bedraggled Ibrox side on derby day last month and he [...]
articles.title: FOCUSED McCOWAN EYES PARADISE HAT-TRICK

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LISBON LION Jim Craig didn’t exactly hit the headlines when he made his first-team debut for Celtic FIFTY-NINE years ago. The cultured right-back got the nod from Jock Stein to play in the second leg of the European Cup-Winners’ Cup-tie against Dutch club Go Ahead Deventer on October 7 1965. The Hoops had won the [...]
articles.title: THE ARRIVAL OF A LISBON LION 59 YEARS AGO – COURTESY OF THE No.62 TO AUCHENSHUGGLE

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: I don’t know who started it, but by the day Nicolas Kuhn landed in Glasgow in January to complete his move to Celtic, the country’s biggest selling newspapers and commercial broadcaster were running “Honestly terrible” headlines about our prospective new winger. That verdict was proffered by a football fan from Austria, whose credentials in the [...]
articles.title: “Honestly Terrible” Merchants

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ALISTAIR JOHNSTON kick-started Celtic’s comeback in the nerve-shredding encounter with Ross County in Dingwall at the weekend. With 14 minutes to go, the Canadian international defender diverted in a drive from Callum McGregor for the crucial equaliser to throw the champions a lifeline. Nicolas Kuhn completed the spirited revival from the visitors with the points-clincher [...]
articles.title: ANOTHER REASON FOR AJ TO CELEBRATE

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: NICOLAS KUHN has revealed why he snubbed Kyogo Furuhashi before scoring the dramatic late winner in Dingwall at the weekend. With just two minutes of the regulation 90 to play and the scoreline deadlocked at 1-1, the in-form German winger sped on to a perfect through pass from Alistair Johnston after a swiftly-taken free-kick from [...]
articles.title: REVEALED: KUHN EXPLAINS REASON FOR SNUBBING KYOGO

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Everything about Celtic in Dingwall yesterday betrayed the fact they suffered a demoralising reversal on Tuesday night.   The confidence visible in Perth 8 days earlier was replaced by hesitancy and misstep.  Ross County did not make it easy for them; the home side packed their defensive lines tightly, Celtic would need to earn any breakthrough. [...]
articles.title: Celtic punish County for stretching play late on

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CELTIC’S majority shareholder Dermot Desmond has admitted he likes “what Brendan is doing” as he puts his weight behind the manager. The Hoops team chief has come in for criticism for refusing to change his open, attacking outlook against Borussia Dortmund in the Westfaelstadion on Tuesday night. The result was a 7-1 thrashing with the [...]
articles.title: DERMOT BACKS BRENDAN

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS praised the true grit attitude of his Celtic players after their late and dramatic 2-1 win over Ross County in Dingwall yesterday. The champions had to dig deep to overcome disciplined and stubborn opponents who had taken the lead just before the interval following a twice-taken VAR-interrupted penalty-kick. Referee Kevin Clancy missed Liam [...]
articles.title: ‘FANTASTIC,’ RODGERS HAILS HIS TRUE GRIT CHAMPS

articles.description: ROSS COUNTY 1 CELTIC 2 IT TOOK a wonder goal from Nicolas Kuhn to earn Celtic their seventh successive league win at the start of the season. articles.author: celtic
articles.description:
AND IF YOU KNOW THE HISTORY? Thirty years ago, a Canadian based businessman called Fergus McCann, took over Celtic Football Club.  The takeover brought to an end a very turbulent few years in the club’s history, a history that stretched back 106 years. The club were only eight minutes from that history ending.   And those […]
The post AND IF YOU KNOW THE HISTORY? appeared first on Celtic Fanzine.
articles.title: AND IF YOU KNOW THE HISTORY?

articles.author: celtic
articles.description:
If we trawl through the long and celebrated history of Celtic it is filled with stories of great victories, titles and cups galore, European Cup glory, a magnificent stadium, the world wide fan base, the Irish and Scottish diaspora, the refusal to take down the tricolour in the 1950’s, the refusal to play in Hungary […]
The post THE DARLING OF CELTIC PARK IN BOTH BELFAST AND GLASGOW appeared first on Celtic Fanzine.
articles.title: THE DARLING OF CELTIC PARK IN BOTH BELFAST AND GLASGOW

articles.author: celtic
articles.description:
I got home from Dortmund on Wednesday evening after a great away trip meeting up with friends from around the globe who made the journey. Everything was great until kick off time. Planes, Trains and Automobiles all on time. We had a great night in Dusseldorf meeting up with friends for drinks, a catch up […]

articles.title: IT IS NOW TIME TO DUST OURSELVES DOWN
